Description: 26 beads in different shape and materials. A: One disc-shaped bead with notches on the outer surface, creating a floral appearance. Made of reddish faience. B: 15 segmented cylindrical beads in different length and slightly varying in width, all made of white faience, the longest have 7 segments preserved. C: Five flattened spherical beads, made of white faience. D: One cylindrical bead with edges around the surface, poorly made, in white faience. E: Four slightly thicker disc-shaped beads, three made of white faience, one in greyish faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.12, early floor
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
